start.text: Ah, another foolish adventurer! What brings you to my lair?

options.text: I'm here to stop the pigs from attacking the chickens.

response.text: Hah! Good luck with that. The pigs have grown too powerful. But perhaps we can strike a deal...
Bring me the Feather of the Golden Rooster, and I may give you the power to defeat the pigs.

options.text: Where can I find the Feather of the Golden Rooster?

response.text: The Feather lies in the heart of the Forbidden Forest, guarded by ferocious beasts. Tread carefully.
Trust is for the weak. Return to me when you have the Feather, or face the wrath of the pigs alone.
Foolish bravery or sheer stupidity? Either way, you won't last long without my help.
I am the Great Wizard Zoltar, master of the dark arts and ruler of these lands. You'd do well to show some respect.

options.text: Why are you helping the pigs?

response.text: Helping? I merely watch and enjoy the chaos. The pigs are a means to an end, a way to spread my influence.

options.text: I'll put an end to your schemes!

response.text: Brave words for someone so powerless. Come back when you're ready to make a real choice.
Despicable, perhaps. But I am also powerful, and power is all that matters.

options.text: I seek your wisdom, great Zoltar.

response.text: Wisdom? From me? Very well, ask your questions and I may grant you some insight.
I want what every great wizard wants: power, control, and the destruction of my enemies. The pigs are merely pawns in my grand design.

options.text: I'll stop you and the pigs!

response.text: Many have tried, all have failed. Perhaps you'll be different, but I doubt it.
A tempting offer. Prove your worth and perhaps we can strike a mutually beneficial arrangement.
